commit_message:
Checksum all traffic traveling though the bridges

In some cases when running an AIO a user may want to run test workloads
from within a VM though some of those workloads may fail due to
networking problems caused by invalid checksums. This change simply
changes the checksum rules from only port 22 to all ports on a provided
interface.

Closes-Bug: #1619730
Change-Id: I04479ff4fc58c51f369876ba5254bdab7b75fc03
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

With Ocata development opened, neutron network segments are no
longer beta resources.

Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

Change-Id: I4ce1745a90b043ea342fb157683b01f862c1bc3d

commit_message:
[WIP] Increase FIXED_RANGE_V6 to a /56

Subnetpools are now used by default, so let's make a bigger V6 cidr
so that we can allocate multiple /64s subnets.

Depends-On: I9f44803cf04b572074bdb4b97ee58827c5611514

Change-Id: I698674033745a7aefba3369a17607af14bcf1453

commit_message:
Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

Change-Id: I5d97b45a6f024cebbe35596a5257b056857b26e7

Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} [testenv:func_logs] commands = bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh" {[testenv:func_base]install_command} {[testenv:func_logs]commands}

ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/plugins git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/roles ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --forcesetenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages}setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ bash -c 'mkdir -p {toxinidir}/logs' bash -c 'rsync --archive --verbose --ignore-errors /var/log/ /openstack/log/ {toxinidir}/logs/ || true' bash -c 'find "{toxinidir}/logs/" -type f | sed "p;s|$|.txt|" | xargs -n2 mv' bash -c 'command gzip --best --recursive "{toxinidir}/logs/"'setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv}

commit_message:
Configure subnode for devstack multinode

The new multinode experimental gate job [1] requires the subnode to
be configured properly as a compute node running the OVN controller.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/373528/

added_lines:
# Setup subnode (i.e. compute node) configuration when running multinode. if [[ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY" == "multinode" ]] ; then export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"enable_plugin networking-ovn http://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-ovn" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"ENABLED_SERVICES=n-cpu,dstat,c-vol,c-bak,ovn-controller" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_L3_CREATE_PUBLIC_NETWORK=True" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_NATIVE_DHCP=True" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_SB_REMOTE=tcp:\$SERVICE_HOST:6642" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_NB_REMOTE=tcp:\$SERVICE_HOST:6641" fi

commit_message:
repos: configure RDO Virtualization repository

Introduce manage_virt boolean (True by default) to whether or not
configure RDO CentOS QEMU EV repository, required when deploying
OpenStack Newton with RDO repositories.

Change-Id: If62801a4975039714d9986a548b2144e448e00f7
(cherry picked from commit bec22573974f7851c141327b749fee980f5e7fdd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_extras refs/changes/47/380347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it { is_expected.to contain_yumrepo('rdo-qemu-ev').with( :baseurl => "http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/virt/$basearch/kvm-common/", :descr => "RDO CentOS-7 - QEMU EV", :gpgkey => "file:///etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-SIG-Virtualization", :enabled => '1', :gpgcheck => '1', :mirrorlist => 'absent', :require => "Anchor[openstack_extras_redhat]", :notify => "Exec[yum_refresh]" )} it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-SIG-Virtualization').with( :source => "puppet:///modules/openstack_extras/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-SIG-Virtualization", :owner => 'root', :group => 'root', :mode => '0644', :before => "Anchor[openstack_extras_redhat]" )} describe 'with rdo-virt management disabled' do let :params do default_params.merge!({ :manage_virt => false }) end it { is_expected.to_not contain_yumrepo('rdo-qemu-ev') } end

commit_message:
Run tempest tests

The utility_all group was not added to nova and the tempest tests are
not being run against the tempest host.

Additionally, scheduling fails if the ansible_host for localhost is
"localhost", it needs to be set to an IP to prevent failures such as:

ValueError: failed to detect a valid IP address from 'localhost'

The defaulted "neutron_provider_networks" in the common test repository
takes precedence over the host_vars in the repository, we need to change
this by setting it in the nova-overrides.

This PR fixes that.

Change-Id: If7b731814a16593434952300679deb286093d899

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Revert "Revert "Revert "Disable rax-iad due to launch failure rate"""""

We have a new release of glean that fixes IPv4/IPv6 support for
rax-iad, we can finally bring the region back online.

This reverts commit 1f99d5fb70b42ee902e227d2e3ce2136b915f1ae.

Change-Id: I51ac60f758e74e7c13f7891a9ec57a43e05b1011
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix race condition on starting services

We're seeing a lot of failures for loading the neutron-linuxbridge-agent
on localhost in gating. There is a race condition that means the service
start is attempted before the configuration file is placed.

Although, this doesn't happen all the time - it suggests the static
inclusion on the init tasks may well be causing this error.

Change-Id: Ia9fbf588f64afe0e979163a319d3c07162ae8e17
Closes-Bug: #1628851
(cherry picked from commit 52965e146018b72a69b5e0350b087be04ea81ee9)

commit_message:
Fix for LV mounting issue in docker containers

Docker containers were previously started with insufficient
privileges to successfully mount a LV created on host.
This change fixes this problem.

Closes-Bug: 1613675
Change-Id: I63f3480ace3be70100a245570d7f3579b333e972

subject: Fixed swift::proxy::cache requirement on memcached
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 15:03:20.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/swift_proxy_cache_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-memcached-require-for-proxy-cache-cbb2726d22b53d80.yaml', 'manifests/proxy/cache.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/3ae58f377b48668d7c3e113a8cbe269f12fa2fd2', 'message': 'Fixed swift::proxy::cache requirement on memcached

Fixed the incorrect inclusion of a requirement for the memcached class
to be in the catalog for swift::proxy::cache due to a bad grep of
the memcached server list. The grep command will return an array of
matching values. Unfortunately this includes if nothing is found so the
if condition was always matching. Now if you are not using a local
memcache server on 127.0.0.1, the memcached class is not required to
be in the catalog.

Change-Id: I79b92dc67e46dfa0b62ba07b00633de6fb17bf1e
Closes-Bug: #1628967
(cherry picked from commit fbbcd892358d47f5734adcefd5406146a6f33d0e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed swift::proxy::cache requirement on memcached

Fixed the incorrect inclusion of a requirement for the memcached class
to be in the catalog for swift::proxy::cache due to a bad grep of
the memcached server list. The grep command will return an array of
matching values. Unfortunately this includes if nothing is found so the
if condition was always matching. Now if you are not using a local
memcache server on 127.0.0.1, the memcached class is not required to
be in the catalog.

Change-Id: I79b92dc67e46dfa0b62ba07b00633de6fb17bf1e
Closes-Bug: #1628967
(cherry picked from commit fbbcd892358d47f5734adcefd5406146a6f33d0e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/70/380370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
upgrade tests: don't patch gnocchi 3.0

The upgrade tests was patching gnocchi 2.2 with a patch not yet release
on that branch.

This is not needed when Gnocchi version is not 2.2.0. So this change
applies the patch only on Gnocchi 2.2.0.

Change-Id: I33ceb9ec06bf10ac896d037b7a76f6296f9e5a09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/53/380353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_version=$(pip freeze | sed -n '/gnocchi==/s/.*==\(.*\)/\1/p') if [ "${old_version:0:3}" == "2.2" ]; then # NOTE(sileht): temporary fix a gnocchi 2.2 bug # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/369011/ patch -p2 -d $VIRTUAL_ENV/lib/python*/site-packages/gnocchi < 7bcd2a25.diff fi
deleted_lines: # NOTE(sileht): temporary fix a gnocchi 2.2 bug # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/369011/ patch -p2 -d $VIRTUAL_ENV/lib/python*/site-packages/gnocchi < 7bcd2a25.diffold_version=$(pip freeze | sed -n '/gnocchi==/s/.*==\(.*\)/\1/p')

commit_message:
Fix create/update keystone endpoint with service name

Added the translation rule to retrieve service id for the parameter service
because service id is expected by the api.

Change-Id: Ic7febb13965c55093aa8fa35a778a643b6609001
Closes-bug: #1566029

commit_message:
Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], there is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: I5cba77d5502077e2323f4e86e0d29364eabf9c4c

commit_message:
conf: Cleanup of glance.py

- Fix indentation
- Add 'min' parameter to 'num_retries' configuration option. Users have
  been warned about this since 2014

Change-Id: Icf1bdc2b9331cfb2f5a699f626c25ebb6d7648b2

deleted_lines: @mock.patch('nova.image.glance.LOG') @mock.patch('time.sleep') @mock.patch('nova.image.glance._glanceclient_from_endpoint') def test_static_client_with_retries_negative(self, create_client_mock, sleep_mock, mock_log): side_effect = glanceclient.exc.ServiceUnavailable self._mock_client_images_response(create_client_mock, side_effect) self.flags(num_retries=-1, group='glance') client = self._get_static_client(create_client_mock) self.assert_retry_not_attempted(sleep_mock, client) self.assertTrue(mock_log.warning.called) msg = mock_log.warning.call_args_list[0] self.assertIn('Treating negative config value', msg[0][0])

commit_message:
report optimal io size for block devices

LVM aligns devices data area to io hints, reported for
block devices. Optimal io size can be big for some devices
(16M, as reported in bug). So nailgun's volume manager
should take it into account while doing partitioning.
So nailgun-agent should send this information to nailgun.

Change-Id: Idd9b778f7f21d4fe9d3fd029038664de41f93447
Partial-Bug: #1546049
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/39/286139/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: opt_io = get_opt_io() :removable => block[:removable], :opt_io => opt_io[dname] def get_opt_io output = `lsblk --nodeps --bytes --json --output NAME,MIN-IO,OPT-IO` data = JSON.parse(output) ret = {} data['blockdevices'].map {|v| ret[v['name']] = (v['opt-io'].to_i != 0 ? v['opt-io'].to_i : v['min-io'].to_i)} ret end

commit_message:
Workaround OVS transaction mutate bug

Using OVS transaction mutate support causes the updated column to
be an empty list after the mutation. This results in subsequent
actions taken based on the column data to be incorrect. The column
data is accurate again once the current transaction completes. It
appears that the OVS python IDL is not properly handling getattr()
after column mutation.

This workaround is needed until OVS is fixed. The workaround drops
transaction mutate support for logical router static routes since
they require numerous column data comparisions within a single
transaction. In addition, OVN DB sync ACL processing had to be
modified to ensure mutations wouldn't impact any comparison. At
this time, no other problems where identified.

The functional tests were updated to test the logical router
static routes problem and other paths with multiple commands
within a mutate transaction.

Recent neutron relocations also required a couple minor unit
test updates.

Change-Id: I11782a74a7b08dbfd54aeb37cfbda68b0b3a2ef9
Related-Bug: 1622647
Partial-Bug: 1629099
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/85/380185/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # support that includes a fix for bug 1629099. Until then, care # must be taken to ensure column data isn't collected after mutation # within the same transaction.def _addvalue_to_list(row, column, new_value, mutate=True): if mutate and _is_ovs_mutate_available(row):def _delvalue_from_list(row, column, old_value, mutate=True): if mutate and _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): for port, port_acls in six.iteritems(self.acl_new_values_dict): for port_acl in port_acls: del_acl_matches.append(port_acl['match']) # TODO(rtheis): Use mutate for adding and deleting static # routes once bug 1629099 is fixed. _addvalue_to_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', row.uuid, mutate=False) # TODO(rtheis): Use mutate for adding and deleting static # routes once bug 1629099 is fixed. _delvalue_from_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', route, mutate=False)
deleted_lines: # support.def _addvalue_to_list(row, column, new_value): if _is_ovs_mutate_available(row):def _delvalue_from_list(row, column, old_value): if _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): for acl_dict in self.acl_new_values_dict.values(): del_acl_matches.append(acl_dict['match']) _addvalue_to_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', row.uuid) _delvalue_from_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', route)

commit_message:
Remove copies of incubated Oslo code.

Per Ocata goal [1], moved openstack/common/apiclient to another
location within the code base. Removed openstack/common/_i18n.py
which graduated to oslo.i18n back in Juno.

[1] http://governance.openstack.org/goals/ocata/remove-incubated-oslo-code.html

Change-Id: If0ad5a6e1463c0add5b42b91a862c033c3935aea

commit_message:
Move the rest of static roles resource registry entries to j2

Moving the rest of the static based resource registry
entries to j2, this allows to extend the content of the
template to the roles_list.

Also moved the templates to correspond with the role name.

Partial-Bug: #1626976

Change-Id: I1cbe101eb4ce5a89cba5f2cc45cace43d3380f22

commit_message:
api-ref: add versions history

The 'versions' response contains the status of the Images API versions,
but does not indicate the releases when the statuses went into effect.
This patch adds a Version History to the 'versions' api-ref page.  The
language used (for example, "Bexar changes") is consistent with what's
been adopted for other parts of the images api-ref (see the discussion
on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/356693/ )

This patch is current for Newton:
- v1 deprecation: already merged as commit
  63e6dbb1eb006758fbcf7cae83e1d2eacf46b4ab
- v2 minor version bump: the dependency stated below

Depends-On: I5d1c4380682efa4c15ff0f294f269c800fe6762a

Change-Id: Id920a3284a4be23032cc4a23e04726fab6d24361
Closes-bug: #1621161
Partial-bug: #1618495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/44/366944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Version History *************** .. **Newton changes** .. - version 1.1 is DEPRECATED .. - version 1.0 is DEPRECATED **Kilo changes** - version 2.3 is CURRENT - version 1.1 is SUPPORTED **Havana changes** - version 2.2 is CURRENT - version 2.1 is SUPPORTED **Grizzly changes** - version 2.1 is CURRENT - version 2.0 is SUPPORTED **Folson changes** - version 2.0 is CURRENT **Diablo changes** - version 1.1 is CURRENT - version 1.0 is SUPPORTED **Bexar changes** - version 1.0 is CURRENT

For any openstack git sources, git.openstack.org must be used.

commit_message:
Fix git source in ansible-role-requirements

For any openstack git sources, git.openstack.org must be used.

Change-Id: I8e4b663a2d1c902a2581d494301878e7b67f1a61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/03/380303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: fullstack: VLAN aware VMs test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 18:18:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/aa0b7c74c91fa6a829dafc686cbbab2fdfbd3650', 'message': '[WIP] fullstack: VLAN aware VMs test

Patch tests basic life-cycle of a trunk associated with a port. Test
creates a trunk with one subport - this tests interaction between
agent and ovsdb handler that calls via RPC to server.
Later a new subport is added which tests RPC interaction between
server and agent.

NOTE: Server reports to agent that trunk has no port when fetching for
details. Need to investigate.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

commit_message:
fullstack: VLAN aware VMs test

Patch tests basic life-cycle of a trunk associated with a port. Test
creates a trunk with one subport - this tests interaction between
agent and ovsdb handler that calls via RPC to server.
Later a new subport is added which tests RPC interaction between
server and agent. Then deletes the first created subport. Finally trunk
is removed and checked that no patch ports remain on the integration
bridge.

Future work:
 - Run this test with linuxbridge
 - Test re-using port associated with trunk.
 - Test re-using subports.
 - Test with OVS firewall.

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: Ie79a010e6751c1f1c2be5b1bf52511b9e100ad20

subject: Fix race condition on starting services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 09:55:20.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/neutron_init_common.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/52965e146018b72a69b5e0350b087be04ea81ee9', 'message': "Fix race condition on starting services

We're seeing a lot of failures for loading the neutron-linuxbridge-agent
on localhost in gating. There is a race condition that means the service
start is attempted before the configuration file is placed.

Although, this doesn't happen all the time - it suggests the static
inclusion on the init tasks may well be causing this error.

Change-Id: Ia9fbf588f64afe0e979163a319d3c07162ae8e17
Closes-Bug: #1628851
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition on starting services

We're seeing a lot of failures for loading the neutron-linuxbridge-agent
on localhost in gating. There is a race condition that means the service
start is attempted before the configuration file is placed.

Although, this doesn't happen all the time - it suggests the static
inclusion on the init tasks may well be causing this error.

Change-Id: Ia9fbf588f64afe0e979163a319d3c07162ae8e17
Closes-Bug: #1628851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/69/380069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

SessionState.deploying, which is invalid.

commit_message:
Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

Change-Id: I6f05ec7046d5613804fa8b4c2fb9323370239da0
(cherry picked from commit 0c4bb0fb1bfae8baba33cd0fea07679796855416)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/14/380114/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ROLE_NAME=os_keystone VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} WORKING_DIR={toxinidir}[testenv:tests_clone] commands = bash -c "if [ ! -d "{toxinidir}/tests/common" ]; then \ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests {toxinidir}/tests/common; \ fi" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-pep8.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-bashate.sh" -rhttp://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/plain/test-ansible-deps.txt {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-env-prep.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh"
deleted_lines: git rm wget VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} # Run hacking/flake8 check for all python files bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*python$' \ --exclude-dir .eggs \ --exclude-dir .git \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir *.egg-info \ --exclude-dir doc \ {toxinidir} | xargs flake8 --verbose" # Run bashate check for all bash scripts # Ignores the following rules: # E003: Indent not multiple of 4 (we prefer to use multiples of 2) # E006: Line longer than 79 columns (as many scripts use jinja # templating, this is very difficult) # E040: Syntax error determined using `bash -n` (as many scripts # use jinja templating, this will often fail and the syntax # error will be discovered in execution anyway) bash -c "grep --recursive --binary-files=without-match \ --files-with-match '^.!.*\(ba\)\?sh$' \ --exclude-dir .tox \ --exclude-dir .git \ {toxinidir} | xargs bashate --error . --verbose --ignore=E003,E006,E040" ansible==2.1.1 ansible-lint>=2.7.0,<3.0.0 setenv = {[testenv]setenv} ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING = False ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH = /tmp/%%h-%%r # TODO (odyssey4me) These are only here as they are non-standard folder # names for Ansible 1.9.x. We are using the standard folder names for # Ansible v2.x. We can remove this when we move to Ansible 2.x. ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. ANSIBLE_TRANSPORT = "ssh" PYTHONUNBUFFERED = 1 rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/plugins git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/roles ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --force rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/roles/os_keystone bash -c "ln -s {toxinidir} {homedir}/.ansible/roles/os_keystone" rm -rf {toxinidir}/tests/playbooks git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests \ {toxinidir}/tests/playbookssetenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "keystone_rolename={toxinidir}" \ bash -c 'mkdir -p {toxinidir}/logs' bash -c 'rsync --archive --verbose --ignore-errors /var/log/ /openstack/log/ {toxinidir}/logs/ || true' bash -c 'find "{toxinidir}/logs/" -type f | sed "p;s|$|.txt|" | xargs -n2 mv' bash -c 'command gzip --best --recursive "{toxinidir}/logs/"'setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "keystone_rolename={toxinidir}" \setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "keystone_rolename={toxinidir}" \setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "keystone_rolename={toxinidir}" \setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv}

commit_message:
Disable subtransactions in table locking transaction

Purpose: resolve occasional failure in MySQL table locking,
leading to subsequent 500 errors and loss of functionality.

Change: disable subtransactions to prevent interrupting
DB requests from interefering with table lock. Main issue is
synchronizer interrupting and using the same session, leading
MySQL generate errors about subtransaction not locking tables

Change-Id: Ia1031961c83e83d4b996d9eedc7261edd6a91e17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/08/380108/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Main issue is # synchronizer interrupting and using the same session, leading # MySQL to complain about subtransaction not locking tables

commit_message:
Increase the timeout of diag snapshot generation

As we have recently added new files to diagnostic snapshots the snapshot
generation procedure might time out on big environments.
The commit increases the timeout for the diagnostic snapshot generation
procedure from 10 to 30 minutes. It helps avoid growing amount of
timed outs during snapshot compressing.

Change-Id: Iab1347e1af68e5e67fca819ef00e7741df4cb2ae
Closes-Bug: #1491356

commit_message:
compute: Skip driver detach calls for non local instances

Only call for a driver detach from a volume if the instance is currently
associated with the local compute host. This avoids potential virt
driver and volume backend issues when attempting to disconnect from
volumes that have never been connected to from the current host.

NOTE(lyarwood): Test conflict caused by the mox to mock migration in
I8d4d8a. As a result test_rebuild_on_remote_host_with_volumes remains a
mox based test.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py

Closes-Bug: #1583284
Change-Id: I36b8532554d75b24130f456a35acd0be838b62d6
(cherry picked from commit fdf3328107e53f1c5578c2e4dfbad78d832b01c6)

commit_message:
Add STRICT_RESPONSE_HEADERS check to gabbi tests

This uses a new feature in wsgi_intercept 1.4.1 that checks to make
sure that response headers are native str type (different things in
Python 2 and 3). Since Pecan is well behaved this "just works".
Tested locally with both py27 and py35.

Change-Id: I1406cfbfa14f69132fc91549779424b8427e7b78

commit_message:
Use xx=None instead of xx=[] to initialize the default value

When using a "mutable" xx = [] as the default parameter value, this
parameter will only be initialized at the first call. If executed
multiple times, it wil create a new function object each time. Modifying
the default value to None to avoid more confusion. The solution is
initialize xx with xx= xx or [] in method body.

More details:http://effbot.org/zone/default-values.htm

Change-Id: I8266e5dbf0b4bf1b12e584cb0a58e277ba4d4334

commit_message:
dev-docs: mark v1 as deprecated

This patch consists of changes to the Glance developer docs to
indicate that the Images API v1 has been deprecated in Newton.

Change-Id: Idf62cf86cd402b2f39a7233f7159ba81dad02bb9
Partial-bug: #1618495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/73/380173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: The Images API v1 has been DEPRECATED in the Newton release. The migration path is to use the `Images API v2 <http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/>`_ instead of version 1 of the API. The Images API v1 will ultimately be removed, following the `OpenStack standard deprecation policy <https://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/assert_follows-standard-deprecation.html>`_.

commit_message:
Revert dynamic include for inventory-based conditionals

Forcing dynamic includes for inventory-based conditionals
results in incomplete execution.

As the install tasks are selective based on the role of
the target host group, the dynamic include needs to be
reverted.

Change-Id: I8192333237f041d7573ef6b1846d8ca13bc6d443

commit_message:
Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

The tests are adjusted so that the central tests
repo configuration do not clash with the tests.

Change-Id: I8265d00c0e7c6ba9ee483098effed4e20027398b
(cherry picked from commit 61587e89fb9b64811984752d6995b910e556756c)

commit_message:
Update heat actions in mapping.json

The "heat resource-mark-unhealthy" (or "openstack stack resource mark
unhealthy") command allows the user to mark a resource as failed. This
will cause Heat to create a replacement during the next stack update,
while still respecting all of the dependency relationships within the
template (so e.g. if a server gets replaced then floating IPs get moved
to the new server and so on). Therefore this is critical to being able
to use Mistral to automatically recover applications after e.g. a server
dies.

The "heat stack-environment" command for downloading the environment of
a stack is also added.

Change-Id: I7888c281db121cb99c0d18491bc0ee0bd0c7b473

commit_message:
Fix check for GPT partioned device

The check for determining if a device was GPT partioned was incorrect.

This was due to the fact that the blkid output for a GPT partioned
device would have been: ('gpt\n', '') and the test was checking for
'gpt' in the output.

Change-Id: Ifdae7c5bfe01d100b1a94e83a4475ac2523483dc
Closes-Bug: #1626671
(cherry picked from commit ddef39b5023bf6c8d1b4842900d2b90a11f9d819)

deleted_lines: output = utils.execute('blkid', '-p', '-o', 'value', '-s', 'PTTYPE', device, use_standard_locale=True, run_as_root=True) return 'gpt' in output

commit_message:
VMware: deprecate wsdl_location conf option

The wsdl_location is no longer needed. It was only required to be
set when connecting to a vCenter of version less than 5.1. The
current minimum version of the VMware vCenter driver is 5.1, so
its time to deprecate and later remove this option.

Change-Id: Ifffb90d5cc8143aac9b472d25d5fcb69b3252b92

commit_message:
Add Amulet Tests

This change adds amulet tests to the charm and fixes a bug
causing the status to never report a unit ready state which
was blocking amulet runs.

Closes-Bug: 1604172
Change-Id: I345fb1a3c63a17f1b0070426d06c517c908c7d81

added_lines: def test_large_ops_scenario(self): name = data_utils.rand_name('scenario-server') flavor_id = CONF.compute.flavor_ref # First set of servers self.create_server( name=name, flavor=flavor_id, image_id=image, min_count=CONF.scenario.large_ops_number, wait_until='ACTIVE') # Second set of servers self.create_server( name=name, flavor=flavor_id, image_id=image, min_count=CONF.scenario.large_ops_number, wait_until='ACTIVE') # Third set of servers self.create_server( name=name, flavor=flavor_id, image_id=image, min_count=CONF.scenario.large_ops_number, wait_until='ACTIVE')
deleted_lines: @classmethod def addCleanupClass(cls, function, *arguments, **keywordArguments): cls._cleanup_resources.append((function, arguments, keywordArguments)) def _wait_for_server_status(self, status): for server in self.servers: # Make sure nova list keeps working throughout the build process self.servers_client.list_servers() waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, server['id'], status) def nova_boot(self, image): name = data_utils.rand_name('scenario-server') flavor_id = CONF.compute.flavor_ref # Explicitly create secgroup to avoid cleanup at the end of testcases. # Since no traffic is tested, we don't need to actually add rules to # secgroup secgroup = self.security_groups_client.create_security_group( name='secgroup-%s' % name, description='secgroup-desc-%s' % name)['security_group'] self.addCleanupClass(self.security_groups_client.delete_security_group, secgroup['id']) create_kwargs = { 'min_count': CONF.scenario.large_ops_number, 'security_groups': [{'name': secgroup['name']}] } network = self.get_tenant_network() create_kwargs = fixed_network.set_networks_kwarg(network, create_kwargs) self.servers_client.create_server( name=name, imageRef=image, flavorRef=flavor_id, **create_kwargs) # needed because of bug 1199788 params = {'name': name} server_list = self.servers_client.list_servers(**params) self.servers = server_list['servers'] for server in self.servers: # after deleting all servers - wait for all servers to clear # before cleanup continues self.addCleanupClass(waiters.wait_for_server_termination, self.servers_client, server['id']) for server in self.servers: self.addCleanupClass(self.servers_client.delete_server, server['id']) self._wait_for_server_status('ACTIVE') def _large_ops_scenario(self): image = self.glance_image_create() self.nova_boot(image) def test_large_ops_scenario_1(self): self._large_ops_scenario() @test.idempotent_id('b9b79b88-32aa-42db-8f8f-dcc8f4b4ccfe') @test.services('compute', 'image') def test_large_ops_scenario_2(self): self._large_ops_scenario() @test.idempotent_id('3aab7e82-2de3-419a-9da1-9f3a070668fb') @test.services('compute', 'image') def test_large_ops_scenario_3(self): self._large_ops_scenario()

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 13:00:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/fa0fa440d6dfa1e62585d7ede166335767d8a254', 'message': 'Improve functional tests and test client

This patch includes a couple of small functional test improvement.

A. Change swift_test_client.File.sync_metadata to follow Swift object
metadata semantics:

swift_test_client.File.sync_metadata is designed to post object user
metadata to an object. However, prior to this patch, the
swift_test_client.File instance keeps the existing object metadata as
its member attribute and if sync_metadata is called, it sends both
existing metadata and incomming metadata from caller. It looks to result
in the odd state as if Swift keeps the existing metadata when POST
object requested.

To tell the correct Swift object metadata semantics, when POST object
requested, the existing metadata in the stored object should be gone
even if no metadata is overwritten.

i.e.
if POST object with 'X-Object-Meta-Key: Val' to a stored object with
'X-Object-Meta-foo: bar', it will result in an object with
'X-Object-Meta-Key' (note that X-Object-Meta-Foo will be deleted)

The prior behavior sometimes make us confused in the reviw [1] so that,
this patch fixes it to send only incomming metadata if it's set.

B. Check the response status code more strictly for ObjectVersioning case

This patch fixes test_versioning_check_acl on both TestObjectVersioning and
TestObjectVersioningHistoryMode to assert the response status code
explisitly instead of asserting just "ResponseError". (e.g. 403 when trying
to delete object from other account)

1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360933/1/test/functional/tests.py@4142

commit_message:
Improve functional tests and test client

This patch includes a couple of small functional test improvement.

A. Change swift_test_client.File.sync_metadata to follow Swift object
metadata semantics:

swift_test_client.File.sync_metadata is designed to post object user
metadata to an object. However, prior to this patch, the
swift_test_client.File instance keeps the existing object metadata as
its member attribute and if sync_metadata is called, it sends both
existing metadata and incomming metadata from caller. It looks to result
in the odd state as if Swift keeps the existing metadata when POST
object requested.

To tell the correct Swift object metadata semantics, when POST object
requested, the existing metadata in the stored object should be gone
even if no metadata is overwritten.

i.e.
if POST object with 'X-Object-Meta-Key: Val' to a stored object with
'X-Object-Meta-foo: bar', it will result in an object with
'X-Object-Meta-Key' (note that X-Object-Meta-Foo will be deleted)

The prior behavior sometimes make us confused in the reviw [1] so that,
this patch fixes it to send only incomming metadata if it's set.

B. Check the response status code more strictly for ObjectVersioning case

This patch fixes test_versioning_check_acl on both TestObjectVersioning and
TestObjectVersioningHistoryMode to assert the response status code
explisitly instead of asserting just "ResponseError". (e.g. 403 when trying
to delete object from other account)

1: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360933/1/test/functional/tests.py@4142

Change-Id: Ia3e5b40f17dc0f881b695aa4be39c98b91e2bb06

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-pkg-check refs/changes/31/377631/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from muranopkgcheck import yaml_loaderAPPLIES_VALUES = frozenset(['Package', 'Type', 'Method', 'Property', 'Argument', 'All']) error.register.E027(description='Cardinality is not One or Many') error.register.E028(description='Applies has one of not possible values') self.add_checker(self._null_checker, 'Usage', False) self.add_checker(self._valid_inherited, 'Inherited', False) self.add_checker(self._valid_cardinality, 'Cardinality', False) self.add_checker(self._valid_applies, 'Applies', False) def _valid_inherited(self, inherited): if not isinstance(inherited, bool): yield error.report.E027(_('Inherited is not bool"{0}"') .format(inherited), inherited) def _valid_cardinality(self, cardinality): if cardinality not in ('One', 'Many'): yield error.report.E027( _('Wrong Cardinality "{0}"').format(cardinality), cardinality) def _valid_applies(self, applies, allow_list=True): if allow_list and isinstance(applies, list): for apl in applies: yield self._valid_applies(apl) else: if applies not in APPLIES_VALUES: yield error.report.E028( _('Wrong Applies "{0}"').format(applies), applies)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 20:10:00.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/swift_proxy_cache_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-memcached-require-for-proxy-cache-cbb2726d22b53d80.yaml', 'manifests/proxy/cache.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/fbbcd892358d47f5734adcefd5406146a6f33d0e', 'message': 'Fixed swift::proxy::cache requirement on memcached

commit_message:
Fixed swift::proxy::cache requirement on memcached

Fixed the incorrect inclusion of a requirement for the memcached class
to be in the catalog for swift::proxy::cache due to a bad grep of
the memcached server list. The grep command will return an array of
matching values. Unfortunately this includes if nothing is found so the
if condition was always matching. Now if you are not using a local
memcache server on 127.0.0.1, the memcached class is not required to
be in the catalog.

Change-Id: I79b92dc67e46dfa0b62ba07b00633de6fb17bf1e
Closes-Bug: #1628967

commit_message:
Temporarily skip test_cluster_cli to avoid timeouts

The test consistently fails and it seems that the gates can not instantiate
the requested number of instances.

The test is new (== never enabled in a released version of sahara-tests),
so this is not a regression.

Change-Id: Ic53e3e0d6ddf7622d12e17aeeab73c117bfe0fd3

commit_message:
Fix creation of ng with proxy node

We have incorrect mechanism of creation ng
with enabled is_proxy_gateway. IPs still apply to instances

commit_message:
Use gabbi inner_fixtures for better error capture

Upgrade to gabbi 1.26.1 to use the new inner_fixtures feature to
capture log and stdout/stderr per individual test request. The
existing nova fixtures are used for the capture.

Depends-On: Ic13dc14f62334aefbcced93872ec564cab157898
Change-Id: Ic6f5a50df37b4680a60c4aa94f7587aec232c367
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/379342/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures # These inner fixtures provide per test request output and log # capture, for cleaner results reporting. inner_fixtures = [ nova_fixtures.OutputStreamCapture, nova_fixtures.StandardLogging, ] inner_fixtures=inner_fixtures,

commit_message:
Add root-marker file to translated manuals

This is needed for publishing in the future:
This is so that we can create a list of directories to ignore when we
rsync documentation builds to a publishing site. Some builds are
published as subdirectories underneath the results of superior
builds.

This allows those superior builds to be rsynced without removing the
other builds that were published under them.

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack-infra/infra-specs/specs/doc-publishing.html

Change-Id: Ic8773caebecafa87b10c1ad4612bde6b1513b667
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/16/371316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This marker is needed for Infra publishing and needs to go into the # root directory of each translated manual as file ".root-marker". MARKER_TEXT="Project: $ZUUL_PROJECT Ref: $ZUUL_REFNAME Build: $ZUUL_UUID" PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build-${tag}/html/ ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/${language}/${book}/ mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html/ ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker
deleted_lines: mkdir -p publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build-${tag}/html/ \ publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} publish-docs/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p publish-docs/${language}/${book}/ rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html/ \ publish-docs/${language}/${book}/

commit_message:
Do not make project depends on Babel by default

There's no reason to depend on it as it's not needed to run the
application or use the library. We also remove it from cookiecutter
in Icc847c6a5cb194a77abfca6134444903cf7b8db5

Change-Id: Ief496765f4d3333204b5042b00c0939cbdd345a9

commit_message:
Report actual request_spec when MaxRetriesExceeded raised

If a MaxRetriesExceeded exception is raised by
scheduler_utils.populate_retry then request_spec will be empty in the
exception handler[1], then _set_vm_state_and_notify method will just
put a empty dict as request_spec into the payload of notification[2].
It would make more sense if we report the actual value of request_spec
in the notification.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc3/nova/conductor/manager.py#L382
[2]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0.0rc3/nova/scheduler/utils.py#L109

Simply moving the initialization of request_spec up one line before the
call to populate_retry should fix the issue.

Change-Id: I7c51f635d52f368c8df549f62024cbdf64a032b3
Closes-Bug: #1575998

commit_message:
Refactoring of Instance::ipAddresses retrieving

This patch moves network-related heat output processing
from Instance class to Network subclasses
There are 2 reasons for this patch:
1. Instance::ipAddresses should be retrieved from Network subclasses
instead of direct reading Heat template output in Instance.
In current implementation ipAddresses property initialized
from Instance output in Heat template.
The same information can be retrieved via Instance::joinedNetworks
property with Network method usage.
It breaks single responsibility principle.
2. Implementation details of resource classes methods
should be hidden from Instance objects

Change-Id: Id26c65b6e73da64fe0b930a6a4c1594aa829ccea

added_lines: Deployment behind firewall/proxy server ======================================= If a proxy server is need to access internet in deployment environment, it must be configured for Kolla when impacted services are enabled. .. note:: Impacted services: magnum, kuryr. Proxy servers need to be configured in ``globals.yml``: :: docker_common_options: auth_email: "{{ docker_registry_email }}" auth_password: "{{ docker_registry_password }}" auth_registry: "{{ docker_registry }}" auth_username: "{{ docker_registry_username }}" restart_policy: "{{ docker_restart_policy }}" restart_retries: "{{ docker_restart_policy_retry }}" environment: KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY: "{{ config_strategy }}" http_proxy: "http://my-proxy-server.company.com:8080" https_proxy: "http://my-proxy-server.company.com:8081" no_proxy: "localhost,127.0.0.1,\ {% for host in groups['all'] -%}\ {{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + api_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }},\ {%- endfor %}\ {{ kolla_internal_vip_address }},\ {{ kolla_external_vip_address }},\ {{ kolla_internal_fqdn }},\ {{ kolla_external_fqdn }}"

commit_message:
Restore RPM dependency on python-etcd

https://review.openstack.org/379528 just removed networking-calico's
dependency on calico-common, but calico-common used to pull in
python-etcd, which we do need.  Now add a direct RPM dependency of
networking-calico on python-etcd.

(For the Debian packaging, I believe this is covered by the
${python:Depends} magic.)

Change-Id: I67e8a754fd3d325849bc3f4fab7ade229bf9ac51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/32/380332/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
repos: configure RDO Virtualization repository

Introduce manage_virt boolean (True by default) to whether or not
configure RDO CentOS QEMU EV repository, required when deploying
OpenStack Newton with RDO repositories.

subject: Add method for checking whether a share is local
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-28 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'os_win/tests/utils/storage/test_smbutils.py', 'os_win/utils/storage/smbutils.py', 'os_win/utils/hostutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/test_hostutils.py', 'os_win/tests/test_utils.py', 'os_win/_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/33e9af9377a06fa35f48bd9012f32faf9b97763d', 'message': "Add method for checking whether a share is local

Mounting loopback highly available shares is not supported.

The Hyper-V Nova driver needs a way to check whether a share is
local and use the local path in that case.

This change adds a method that attempts to resolve the share server
address and compare the IPs with the local IPs.

In case of a share exposed by a Scale-Out server, we'll use the
Distributed Node Name of the share, which points to all the nodes
of the cluster.

ddt is added as a requirement.

Change-Id: I04ac0b514ccac9c910728da205f0f0f11b43509a
Partial-Bug: #1580122
(cherry picked from commit 111db692aee566ba63041f993d6e16237ed9abde)
"}]
commit_message:
Add method for checking whether a share is local

Mounting loopback highly available shares is not supported.

The Hyper-V Nova driver needs a way to check whether a share is
local and use the local path in that case.

This change adds a method that attempts to resolve the share server
address and compare the IPs with the local IPs.

In case of a share exposed by a Scale-Out server, we'll use the
Distributed Node Name of the share, which points to all the nodes
of the cluster.

ddt is added as a requirement.

Change-Id: I04ac0b514ccac9c910728da205f0f0f11b43509a
Partial-Bug: #1580122
(cherry picked from commit 111db692aee566ba63041f993d6e16237ed9abde)

commit_message:
Revert "Fix the logic of if used with is_service_enabled"

This commit changed logic, please have look:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/583580/

As result ironic-grenade job become broken since fixed_network_name
is not set.

This reverts commit 4c813ac0fb64c7b4eeec7f67692ccfd7affd2153.

Change-Id: Id927501bdfeb90199f3114afb3194614ad491c21

commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I20856588f995626d51aa2125046a08b3b301128d

commit_message:
Consolidation of multiple Action-plans into a single one

Different goals result in a different flow of suggested actions (aka 
Action Plan). A consolidation mechanism could combine all Action Plans 
generated from an Audit into a single flow of Actions to be executed.

Change-Id: I6c5e57e39a8a362ba738f18217b054ef6959926d
Implements: blueprint action-plans-consolidation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/71/298871/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Consolidation of multiple Action-plans into a single one ======================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/action-plans-consolidation Different goals result in a different flow of suggested actions (aka Action Plan). In addition, a potential Audit might incorporate multiple Goals. A consolidation mechanism could combine all Action Plans generated from an Audit into a single flow of Actions to be executed. Using heuristic algorithms the sub-optimal solution of all goals will be identified. Problem description =================== In the context of optimizing a Cluster it is realistic that we might want to fulfill multiple Goals in a single Audit. However, the definition of a Strategy that considers multiple Goals and suggests the optimal course of Actions can be a very complex and time consuming task. The performance impact of applying multi-objective optimization in real-time Audit evaluation would be significant and could risk the effectiveness and efficiency of the Watcher framework. Another challenge of this problem is that depending on the identified Goals there might be conflicting Actions that will have to be taken. In addition, the priority or importance of each Goal could play a significant role in the definition of the flow of Actions and Strategy compiled. In this specification we are capturing some potential changes to the Watcher architecture and operation that would allow to consider multiple Goals in an Audit but still handle the Strategy generation independent to each Goal, thus simplifying the Action Plan definition. The rational of this suggested solution is to keep the alterations of the existing Watcher architecture to a minimum level and provide an effective and simple solution that could be integrated into the existing architecture. The actor responsible for setting that priority of the Goals and therefore the Action Plans is the Administrator and he is also responsible for dealing with potential conflicts of objectives. The consolidated Action Plan will be a sub-optimum solution to the multi-objective Audit but is an initial step towards the aggregation of multiple Action Plans. The described feature will be delivered as an optional, independent module that could be integrated with the Watcher Decision Engine. Use Cases ---------- The actor involved and affected from this specification is the Administrator. The functionality described here would allow the Administrator of a Cluster to define Audit Templates and Audits that include more than one Goals. Following that, when triggering the Audit, the Watcher Decision Engine would compose a respective Action Plan that aggregates the flows of Actions for each Goal. Project Priority ----------------- TBD Proposed change =============== For the suggested consolidation of multiple Action Plans we are making the following assumptions: * an Audit can contain more than one Goals * if more than one Goals are defined, they need to be prioritized in an ordered way. * there are no specific information about the actions and we cannot parallelize the execution of two Action Plans. * if there is a conflict of Actions between two Action Plans (e.g. apply a change over the same resource), the Action in the plan with higher priority prevails. For the realization of this mechanism changes have to be performed at the definition of Audit Templates and Audits. The Administrator should be able to define more than one Goals in the respective resources. Subsequently, that might affect the Watcher API triggered through the Watcher CLI and also minor changes might be needed in the Watcher Database in order to support that structure. The more important changes are related with the Watcher Decision Engine. This component will be responsible for acquiring the Strategy and afterwards the Action Plan for each Goal, and then trigger the consolidation algorithm. The rational of the consolidation is that the Action Plan with higher priority is executed first and then the rest Action Plans follow in the correct order. If an Action has already been performed then is skipped. If an Action contradicts a previously executed Actions then the first is skipped as well. Alternatives ------------ Alternative consolidation algorithms could be applied in order to aggregate the Action Plans of an Audit. If we could extrapolate dependency information from the available Actions then we could parallelize the execution of the Actions and transform the problem to a scheduling one. For example, a live migration of a VM could be performed in parallel with the changing of the power level of a different compute node. In relation with that approach, the problem could be formulated as a Job Shop Scheduling problem with A the collection of Actions that can performed independently, P the collection of Action Plans resulted from the Audit. Based on the Actions dependencies, the dependencies of the given Action Plans could be identified and then the optimum scheduling of the plan execution could be performed. Data model impact ----------------- There are no major changes needed to the Data model. The dependency between an Audit template and the Goal needs to be one-to-many. REST API impact --------------- There is no impact on the REST API. Security impact --------------- There is no impact on the Security. Notifications impact -------------------- There is no impact on the notifications. Other end user impact --------------------- The end user (administrator) could select multiple Goals in an Audit template. Performance Impact ------------------ The consolidation module will be triggered every time that an Audit with multiple Goals is being processed. While the suggested operation is simply an aggregation and ordering mechanism, the performance impact would be minimal. Other deployer impact --------------------- No specific deployer impact is envisaged. Developer impact ---------------- It will not impact other developers working on OpenStack. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Intel is leading this work. Main assignee: Gregory Katsaros <gregory-katsaros> Secondary assignee: Thijs Metsch <tmetsch> Work Items ---------- Workplan: * Finalization of the conceptual methodology * Updates on Wathcer APIs and architecture. Definition of Consolidator APIs and introduction of mock-up module. * Implementation of Consolidator * Integration and testing Dependencies ============ No direct dependencies. Testing ======= Several unit tests will be provided to test scenarios using a mock-up Audits and Goals models. Testing approaches similar to the basic consolidation strategy will be used, comprising of unit tests and integration tests in which a specific input is given and compared against the expected output. Documentation Impact ==================== It will be necessary to add new content relating to this Audit and Action Plans operation of the Watcher Decision Engine. References ========== This work is related with research and development activities in the context of the CloudWave EU project (www.cloudwave-fp7.eu). History ======= No history.

Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to skip dtabase creation steps

after https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/
commit/7334ceb347329ccbc04dc6bff536e88e12783a86 we do not need to
create db, user, role.

Also add usage of CUSTOM_OSTF_CONFIG env variable, to pass
correctly dbpath tp fuel_plugin.config.py

Closes-Bug: #1554086

Change-Id: Ic2881e1cb17693ab616044029325a601d2b04e2c
(cherry picked from commit 003272dc29ac9f917a2001d3228674685e1613a6)

commit_message:
Mark Images v1 API as DEPRECATED

The Images v1 API is DEPRECATED in the Newton release by commit
63e6dbb1eb006758fbcf7cae83e1d2eacf46b4ab

This patch moves the link to the Images v1 api-ref to the 'Deprecated'
section of the quick-start landing page.  (The dependency noted below
marks the Images v1 API as DEPRECATED in the api-ref source.)

Change-Id: I1defb2bc5d71c1086335496a7961347f863bc863
Depends-on: Ifa71b6375a63a9ddf182448a78192d6c76ed7fba
Partial-bug: #1618495

commit_message:
Use dictionary for service group mappings

Change the 'heat_service_names' from a list to a dictionary mapping
of services, groups that install those services. This brings the
method into line with that used in the os_neutron role in order to
implement a more standardised method.

The init tasks have been updated to run once and loop through this
mapping rather than being included multiple times and re-run against
each host. This may potentially reduce role run times.

Currently the reload of upstart/systemd scripts may not happen if
only one script changes as the task uses a loop with only one result
register. This patch implements handlers to reload upstart/systemd
scripts to ensure that this happens when any one of the scripts
change.

The handler to reload the services now only tries to restart the
service if the host is in the group for the service according to the
service group mapping. This allows us to ensure that handler
failures are no longer ignored and that no execution time is wasted
trying to restart services which do not exist on the host.

Finally:
- Common variables shared by each service's template files have
  been updated to use the service namespaced variables.
- Unused handlers have been removed.
- Unused variables have been removed.

Change-Id: I3624bd17995f00f63fe1243f4ea22db4b74832f4

commit_message:
Add "Register Image" step to cluster creation guide

Now in cluster creation guide missed step
about image registration. If user will
have no registered images, the candidates
of "select a base image" in the second step
will be null.

Change-Id: I4985adef64c3eb197c094b7c62d4f3e8cbd4332a
Closes-bug: 1603856

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I38f2f1b1429ea49fb02ae1c5cb3e68d547bc1783

commit_message:
Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

Change-Id: I379a67a3178bd10b1a5b0ae0b53289e1355e3ba1
(cherry picked from commit b838299a5382ec3dc3643b86b43183657e944fbe)

subject: Use -L with chown and set crush map tunables when upgrading Ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 00:52:40.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_mon.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/45a7fbb2104e98d9fa269da80ba1259999c1f0e7', 'message': "Use -L with chown and set crush map tunables when upgrading Ceph

Previously the chown command wasn't traversing symlinks, causing
the new ownership to not be set for some needed files.

This change also ensures the crush map tunables are set to the 'default'
profile after the upgrade.

Finally redirects the output of a pidof to /dev/null to avoid spurious
logging.

Change-Id: Id4865ffff207edfc727d729f9cc04e6e81ad19d8
(cherry picked from commit 059307718f4422e0840a90ad40f98947260ac8f1)
"}]
commit_message:
Use -L with chown and set crush map tunables when upgrading Ceph

Previously the chown command wasn't traversing symlinks, causing
the new ownership to not be set for some needed files.

This change also ensures the crush map tunables are set to the 'default'
profile after the upgrade.

Finally redirects the output of a pidof to /dev/null to avoid spurious
logging.

Change-Id: Id4865ffff207edfc727d729f9cc04e6e81ad19d8
(cherry picked from commit 059307718f4422e0840a90ad40f98947260ac8f1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/75/379875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! pidof ceph-osd &> /dev/null; then chown -L -R ceph:ceph $d || echo WARNING: chown of $d failed
deleted_lines: if ! pidof ceph-osd; then chown -R ceph:ceph $d || echo WARNING: chown of $d failed

commit_message:
api-ref: deprecate images v1 api

This patch marks the Images v1 API as DEPRECATED in the api-ref.
The v1 API was deprecated in Newton by the following commit:
63e6dbb1eb006758fbcf7cae83e1d2eacf46b4ab

commit_message:
Add gateway_ip in OS::Neutron::Subnet

This patch allows to :
  - disable the gateway ip for non routable network
  - use the first ip in the subnet
  - set the correct gateway on the external network

Change-Id: Idc816c782856e93ecd339b3aca2a7f53c1564b1d
Closes-bug: #1588379
Depends-On: I8ea6733fe46902e1baeff4ccfbcd42ecc5a1825f
(cherry picked from commit 1fa4c02fc310163da351bacbf19f2d52b46e50b3)

commit_message:
Add support for additional volume-types

Currently, the cinder role only supports creating
one volume-type per configured cinder backend.

This change allows deployers to specify an optional
list ``extra_volume_types`` for any/each of the cinder
backends to create additional volume types and associate
them to the respective backend.

Change-Id: Ie1b1fcaaa355584cbb364ac448f784e3644d668e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-15 16:46:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests/commit/4acc20b90679c1294cf43c73202cf690c6bde316', 'message': 'Fix the retrieval of the floating IP pool

"Floating IP pool" is basically an external network.
`openstack network list --external` seems to work since Liberty (at least)
and it should work with nova-network too (warning: untested).

The alternative (back to openstack ip floating pool list) is blocked by

Change-Id: I5352d4b75fe402a04c9a7eb34ba32df377942c8d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 09:33:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests/commit/5bbb62d332e31fec5c7a3ddcb1841753f553860d', 'message': 'Fix the retrieval of the floating IP pool

"Floating IP pool" is basically an external network.

Change-Id: I5352d4b75fe402a04c9a7eb34ba32df377942c8d
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-22 17:46:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests/commit/19eea719b98a327911305d80eab478931f5ad0ab', 'message': 'Fix the network settings of the templates retrieval of the floating IP pool

Node group templates require a "floating IP pool" is basically an external
network.
`openstack network list --external` seems to work since Liberty (at least)
and it should work with nova-network too (warning: untested).

The alternative (back to `openstack ip floating pool list`) is blocked by
a regression (it works only with nova-network).

On the other side, the cluster template requires a project network.
The only suitable generic function from Tempest is used, even if
unstable (the cost of rewriting one is higher than fixing the
possible breakages).

Change-Id: I5352d4b75fe402a04c9a7eb34ba32df377942c8d
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-26 12:37:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests/commit/e54230587fd95d75d8447508509d4a30a83d0c38', 'message': 'Fix the network settings of the templates

Node group templates require a "floating IP pool" is basically an external
network.
`openstack network list --external` seems to work since Liberty (at least)
and it should work with nova-network too (warning: untested).

The alternative (back to `openstack ip floating pool list`) is blocked by
a regression (it works only with nova-network).

On the other side, the cluster template requires a project network.
The only suitable generic function from Tempest is used, even if

commit_message:
Fix the network settings of the templates

Node group templates require a "floating IP pool" is basically an external
network.
`openstack network list --external` seems to work since Liberty (at least)
and it should work with nova-network too (warning: untested).

The alternative (back to `openstack ip floating pool list`) is blocked by
a regression (it works only with nova-network).

On the other side, the cluster template requires a project network.
The only suitable generic function from Tempest is used, even if
unstable (the cost of rewriting one is higher than fixing the
possible breakages).

The timeout set in tempest.conf is now used for the cluster creation.

Change-Id: I5352d4b75fe402a04c9a7eb34ba32df377942c8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests refs/changes/97/370997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: floating_pool_list = self.openstack('network list --external') if not floating_pool: # if not empty, there should be at least one element return floating_pool[0]['ID']
deleted_lines: def neutron(self, *args, **kwargs): return self.clients.neutron(*args, **kwargs) floating_pool_list = self.neutron('floatingip-list') network_list = self.openstack('network list') networks = self.parser.listing(network_list) network_name = [p['Name'] for p in networks] pools_name = [p['Name'] for p in floating_pool] if not network_name: raise self.skipException('Network list is empty') if not pools_name: name_net_pool = None id_net_pool = None for net_name in network_name: for pool_name in pools_name: if net_name == pool_name: name_net_pool = net_name if name_net_pool is None: raise self.skipException('Network list and floating ip list do ' 'not have common networks') for network in networks: if network['Name'] == name_net_pool: id_net_pool = network['ID'] return id_net_pool

commit_message:
document configure and verify steps

This improves the documentation for the installation of Trove.

The following items were documented:

* Required ConfigDrive parameter change for taskmanager
* Network regex and driver for Neutron
* Installation of the trove-dashboard component
* Using cloud-init as an alternative for guest-images

Change-Id: I1c5d5bab9e4e73f139bba645cda925176abcce82
Partial-Bug: 1610466

This CR removes some unnecessary duplicate code from the
resource2.Resource._get_id method.  The interperter never executed
the right hand side of the or because this class implements a

'}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code

This CR removes some unnecessary duplicate code from the
resource2.Resource._get_id method.  The interperter never executed
the right hand side of the or because this class implements a
__getattribute__ method that ensures that value.id will never be None.

Additionally, the logic of retrieving an alternate_id is already being
applied in the __getattribute__ method.

Change-Id: I2880ca74bd4d44e32d629807b0fd4ffd49f9fa55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/27/379927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Don't check _alternate_id unless we need to. It's an uncommon # case and it involves looping through the class' dict. id = value.id or getattr(value, value._alternate_id(), None) return id

commit_message:
Trivial - Changes rst markup

Headings, literal text, roles, and text wrapping updated
throughout the file to align with OpenStack rst markup best
practices.

Closes-Bug: #1628144

Change-Id: I2c1ffa3434523f6221a96390b1254601ed6eb6fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/02/377802/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For the list and description of configuration options that can be set for Ceilometer in order to set up the services please see the~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~:file:`etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf.sample`, was removed from version control after the Icehouse release. For more details, please read the file :file:`etc/ceilometer/README-ceilometer.conf.txt`. You can generate this sample~~~~~~~~~called :file:`pipeline.yaml`, next to the :file:`ceilometer.conf` file. The pipeline configuration file can be set in the *pipeline_cfg_file* parameter in :file:`ceilometer.conf`. Multiple chains can be defined in one configuration file.The *interval* parameter in the sources section should be defined in seconds. It determines the cadence of sample injection into the pipeline, where samples are produced under the direct control of an agent, i.e. via a polling cycle as opposed to incoming notifications.* To include all meters, use the ``*`` wildcard symbol. * To define the list of included meters, use the ``meter_name`` syntax * To define the list of excluded meters, use the ``!meter_name`` syntax symbol to select all, e.g. for ``disk.read.bytes``, use ``disk.\*``:file:`setup.cfg`.list of transformer definitions. The names of the transformers should be the same as the names of the related extensions in :file:`setup.cfg`. For a more detailed description, please see the `transformers`_ section of the Administrator Guide of Ceilometer.:file:`setup.cfg`.
deleted_lines: For the list and description of configuration options that can be set for Ceilometer in order to set up the services please see the=========================etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf.sample, was removed from version control after the Icehouse release. For more details, please read the file etc/ceilometer/README-ceilometer.conf.txt. You can generate this sample=========called pipeline.yaml, next to the ceilometer.conf file. The pipeline configuration file can be set in the *pipeline_cfg_file* parameter in ceilometer.conf. Multiple chains can be defined in one configuration file.The *interval* parameter in the sources section should be defined in seconds. It determines the cadence of sample injection into the pipeline, where samples are produced under the direct control of an agent, i.e. via a polling cycle as opposed to incoming notifications.* To include all meters, use the '*' wildcard symbol. * To define the list of included meters, use the 'meter_name' syntax * To define the list of excluded meters, use the '!meter_name' syntax symbol to select all, e.g. for "disk.read.bytes", use "disk.\*"setup.cfg.list of transformer definitions. The names of the transformers should be the same as the names of the related extensions in setup.cfg. For a more detailed description, please see the `transformers`_ section of the Administrator Guide of Ceilometer.setup.cfg.

added_lines: ============= The file :ref:`metadata.yaml` contains a various metadata related to a plugin: Example: .. code-block:: ini # Plugin name name: elasticsearch_kibana # Human-readable name for your plugin title: The StackLight Elasticsearch-Kibana Server Plugin # Plugin version version: '1.0.0' # Description description: Deploy Elasticsearch and the Kibana web interface. # Required fuel version fuel_version: ['8.0', '9.0'] # Licences licenses: ['Apache License Version 2.0'] # Specify author or company name authors: ['Mirantis Inc.'] # A link to the plugin homepage homepage: 'https://github.com/openstack/fuel-plugin-elasticsearch-kibana' groups: ['monitoring'] is_hotpluggable: true # The plugin is compatible with releases in the list releases: - os: ubuntu version: liberty-8.0 mode: ['ha'] deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu - os: ubuntu version: liberty-9.0 mode: ['ha'] deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu - os: ubuntu version: mitaka-9.0 mode: ['ha'] deployment_scripts_path: deployment_scripts/ repository_path: repositories/ubuntu # Version of plugin package package_version: '4.0.0' Fields: * ``name`` -- Name of the plugin that will be in the plugin's RPM file name. The allowed name characters are lowercase letters, dash ``-``, and underscore ``_``. * ``title`` -- Human-readable plugin name displayed on the Fuel web UI. * ``version`` -- Plugin version. For guidelines, see `Semantic Versioning 2.0.0 <http://semver.org/>`_. * ``fuel_version`` -- The Fuel version that your plugin is compatible with. Currently, the builder verifies ``fuel_version`` only against ``package_version``. The ``package_version`` field must be supported by the Fuel versions listed at the bottom of this section. Leaving this field empty will skip the check. For format guidelines, see `_ClassType StrictVersion <http://epydoc.sourceforge.net/stdlib/distutils.version.StrictVersion-class.html>`_. * ``licenses`` -- List the licenses under which your plugin can be distributed. * ``authors`` -- Name of the plugin author. A company or an individual. * ``homepage`` -- A link to page with your plugin. This can be your plugin's GitHub repository page. * ``is_hotpluggable`` -- State if the plugin is hot-pluggable. See :ref:`plugin-hotpluggable`. * ``groups`` -- A group to which your plugin belongs in the Fuel web UI. * ``releases`` -- A list of OpenStack releases compatible with the plugin. * ``releases: os`` -- A compatible Linux distribution for the plugin. The supported values are ``ubuntu`` and ``centos``. Fuel 8.0 supports only Ubuntu. * ``releases: version`` -- A compatible OpenStack release version. Fuel Plugin Builder does not validate the ``releases: version`` field; but if there is no OpenStack release with the same version on the Fuel Master, the user cannot enable the plugin. See also a note in :ref:`install-plugin-builder`. * ``releases: mode`` -- A list of compatible cluster deployment modes. Fuel 8.0 supports only the ``haz`` value. * ``releases: deployment_scripts_path`` -- A path in your plugin directory where all the deployment scripts for the release are. The path is relative to the plugin root. * ``releases: repository_path`` -- A path in your plugin directory where all the packages for the release are. Relative to the plugin root. * ``package_version`` -- A version of the compatible plugin format. To build your plugin, the Fuel Plugin Builder version must be the same as the version of the compatible plugin format or newer. Each new plugin format version introduces new features and, possibly, deprecates some of the old ones. The Fuel master node must support the specific ``package_version``, otherwise, you cannot install the plugin.

Use centralised test scripts

This patch consumes the test scripts implemented by
https://review.openstack.org/375061 to ensure that
the tests and test preparation is consistent and
more maintainable.

Change-Id: I8d80c9d34b018ec73b2517256d7b62dbb2e2609a
(cherry picked from commit 9aafde635d1c9973e52925b235dbf0500622f0f1)

added_lines: ROLE_NAME=repo_server VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} WORKING_DIR={toxinidir}[testenv:tests_clone] commands = bash -c "if [ ! -d "{toxinidir}/tests/common" ]; then \ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests {toxinidir}/tests/common; \ fi" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-pep8.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-bashate.sh" -rhttp://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/plain/test-ansible-deps.txt {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-env-prep.sh" bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh"

We are using the standard folder names for # Ansible v2.x. We can remove this when we move to Ansible 2.x. ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/action ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/callback ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/filter ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/lookup # This is required as the default is the current path or a path specified # in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_LIBRARY = {homedir}/.ansible/plugins/library # This is required as the default is '/etc/ansible/roles' or a path # specified in ansible.cfg ANSIBLE_ROLES_PATH = {homedir}/.ansible/roles:{toxinidir}/.. ANSIBLE_TRANSPORT = "ssh" rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/plugins git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins \ {homedir}/.ansible/plugins rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/roles ansible-galaxy install \ --role-file={toxinidir}/tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml \ --force rm -rf {homedir}/.ansible/roles/repo_server bash -c "ln -s {toxinidir} {homedir}/.ansible/roles/repo_server" rm -rf {toxinidir}/tests/playbooks git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests \ {toxinidir}/tests/playbookssetenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \ bash -c 'mkdir -p {toxinidir}/logs' bash -c 'rsync --archive --verbose --ignore-errors /var/log/ /openstack/log/ {toxinidir}/logs/ || true' bash -c 'find "{toxinidir}/logs/" -type f | sed "p;s|$|.txt|" | xargs -n2 mv' bash -c 'command gzip --best --recursive "{toxinidir}/logs/"'setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv} -e "rolename={toxinidir}" \setenv = {[testenv:ansible]setenv}

commit_message:
Add conditional around the pid clean up process

The NS metadata proxy pid cleanup process hunts for and removes
PIDs executing old code by using version tags. Under certain
conditions it's possible for an old PID to have expired before
the cleanup action has run. This change simply wraps the
`pkill` command with a test to ensure the task isn't failing.
Should a PID actually be cleaned up the task will print to stdout
and log using the logger command.

Closes-Bug: #1627185
Change-Id: I8c012feb399f8ca65172e9404b859c8f6111de35
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit cfb341a368b277d43b30da2e3b9a3431e1ad9c9a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/53/380153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if kill -9 "$ns_pid"; then logger -s "old metadata proxy pid found and has been cleaned up on: \"$ns_pid\"" fi
deleted_lines: (echo "old metadata proxy pid found running clean up on $ns_pid"; kill -9 "$ns_pid")
